text: with Apple releasing the iPad pro to
compete with Microsoft Surface line the
laptop tablet hybrid war is on but which
one should you buy here's how they
compare both devices have very sharp
displays but the iPad pro just edges out
the surface pro screen size the iPad pro
is extremely powerful but it's not as
functional as the surface the pro only
runs Apple's mobile OS which can't hold
a candle to Windows 10 the surface can
run full desktop apps while the iPad pro
only runs mobile apps which often aren't
nearly as rich in features both devices
work with a stylus and Apple's pencil
does a lot but it's likely that most
users won't use all the functionality of
the pencil which also comes with a hefty
price tag meanwhile the surface pen may
not do as much but it does come standard
with the surface they both have optional
keyboard cases the surfaces type cover
has a built-in keyboard and trackpad
just like a laptop on the other hand
Apple's awkwardly designed smart
keyboard has an impressed early
reviewers the iPad pro starts at $800
for this 32 gigabyte model while the
base surface pro 4 comes with 128
gigabytes of storage and the service pen
for only $100 more so basically the
surface pro 4 is a better deal than the
iPad pro because you get a lot more
storage and it works just like a laptop
while the iPad pro is just a really
really big iPad
